title: 112_s1484
content: The Act titled "Hyde and Related Amendments Codification Act" prohibits taxpayer-funded abortions and provides conscience protections by amending Title 1 of the United States Code to include a new chapter on these issues. The "Hyde and Related Amendments Codification Act" includes provisions such as prohibiting funding for abortions, health benefits plans covering abortion, limitations on Federal facilities and employees, and treatment of abortions related to rape, incest, or preserving the life of the mother. It also addresses the use of non-Federal funds for health coverage and non-preemption of other Federal laws. Sec. 301 prohibits the use of Federal funds for abortions. Sec. 302 prohibits funding for health benefit plans that cover abortions. Sec. 303 limits health care services provided at Federal facilities and by employees. The limitation on health benefits coverage for abortion and services at Federal facilities and by Federal employees is outlined in Sec. 303. The text states that no health care service provided by a Federal Government-owned facility or by Federal Government-employed individuals can include abortion. It also allows for the purchase of separate abortion coverage as long as it is paid for with non-government funds. The text allows for the purchase of separate abortion coverage using non-government funds, as long as it is not paid for with federally appropriated funds. The text allows non-Federal health benefits coverage providers to offer abortion coverage using funds not authorized by Federal law, as long as no federally appropriated funds are used.
